  • How to Hack Wi-Fi: Cracking WPA2-PSK Passwords Using Aircrack-Ng « Null Byte

    Welcome back, my greenhorn hackers. When WiFi was first developed in the late 1990s, Wired Equivalent Privacy was created to give wireless communications confidentiality. WEP, as it became known, proved terribly flawed and easily cracked. You can read more about that in my beginner's guide to hacking WiFi. As a replacement, most wireless access points now use WiFi Protected Access II with a preshared key for wireless security, known as WPA2PSK. WPA2 uses a stronger encryption algorithm, AES, that's very difficult to crack—but not impossible. My beginner's WiFi hacking guide also gives

  • Breaking WPA2-PSK with Kali Linux – Doctor Chaos
